data.title: What Is Pete From Mickey Mouse Clubhouse? Answered (2024)
data.meta_description: Who can forget Pete from the Mickey Mouse Clubhouse? His famous line, "No one messes with the mighty Pete!" is certainly one to remember. But what is Pete from Mickey Mouse...
data.text:
Who will ever forget Pete from the Disney Mickey Mouse Clubhouse? His famous line, "No one messes with the mighty Pete!" is certainly one to remember.

He's the one responsible for making the entire Disney Mickey Mouse Universe series more lively and exciting with his signature antics.

If you're wondering exactly what is Pete from Mickey Mouse, check out this in-depth guide we've prepared for you.

What Kind Of Animal Is Pete From Mickey Mouse?

In Disney Mickey Mouse Clubhouse, Pete is an anthropomorphic cat, and he was created by Walt Disney and Ub Iwerks [1].

He is also considered the vile villain and arch-nemesis in the series.

Despite being a feline character, Pete is mistaken for a dog most of the time due to his massive size.

Additionally, he has gone by several names like Big Bad Pete, Black Pete, Terrible Tom, and the infamous Peg Leg Pete.

Who Is Pete From Mickey Mouse?

History

Did you know Pete is one of the oldest continuing Walt Disney characters [2]?

Pete made his first appearance in the cartoon Alice Solves the Puzzle (1925) and in the Disney show Steamboat Willie.

Additionally, Pete from the Mickey Mouse Clubhouse was first designed by Frank Thomas and Ollie Johnston as a bullish strongman with a wooden leg inspired by pirate iconography.

He has received his own Bad Guy Song (Hall of the Mountain King) and is usually mistaken for being a dog due to his massive body size and strong personality.

Peteâ€™s Relationship With Mickey Mouse

Pete (another name, Peg Leg Pete) of the Mickey Mouse Clubhouse is Mickey Mouse's arch nemesis in the Disney show Steamboat Willie, who is often mistaken for a dog.

Pete, along with other villains like Big Bad Wolf, The Phantom Blot, Dangerous Dan, and Idgit the Midget, made the series exciting and crackling as they taunted Mickey's family members.

Age

Believe it or not, Pete may be way older than you. He has been on the air since the 1920s until today, making him one of the oldest classic cartoon characters of all time.

Since Pete debuted three years earlier than Mickey (1925), we can conclude that he is way older than him.

As of today, Mickey is 95 years old. Hence, Pete is 98 years old, making him the oldest character in Disney.

You may want to check out some of our favorite Mickey Mouse gifts here.

Personality

Pete Disney is a villainous cat character created by Disney and Ub Iwerks, particularly in Steamboat Willie.

He has a brutal, ruthless, and tyrannical personality and is commonly known as a cigar-smoking thug that makes him look like a dog (which he is not).

Aside from that, his frequent scheme involves kidnapping Minnie Mouse but his other crimes and victims vary throughout the years.

Physical Description

Pete is an obese black cat (again, not a dog) having a cream-shaven muzzle, pointed ears, black nose, square teeth, double chin, and black fur.

Aside from that, he's always seen wearing a light blue shirt with rolled-up sleeves, blue overalls with white buttons, white gloves, and brown shoes.

Appearances

TV Series

Pete appeared in some TV series, including DuckTales, Goof Troop, House of Mouse, and Mickey Mouse Clubhouse.

Pete also appeared in a short film that includes The Prince and the Pauper and Get a Horse!

Read: Our Top Minnie Mouse Gift Ideas

Movies

Pete has made appearances in more than 40 animated short films. He has also been featured in the Alice Comedies and Oswald the Lucky Rabbit cartoons.

He also appeared in movies like A Goofy Movie, An Extremely Goofy Movie, Mickey's Once Upon A Christmas, Mickey's House of Villains, and The Three Musketeers.

We can say for certain that he's an in-demand Disney character.

FAQs

What kind of cat is Pete from Mickey Mouse?

Pete from Disney Mickey Mouse is an anthropomorphic cat who has been a villainous character since his debut in Alice Solves the Puzzle.

Throughout the Disney Mickey Mouse Clubhouse series and other animated movies from Disney, Pete lived up to his character as a ruthless tyrant and was always up for trouble.

Additionally, his descendants were criminals; even Zeke (Pete's cousin) supports and partners with him in his crimes.

Who is the voice behind Pete from Mickey Mouse?

Many actors lent their voices to Pete, including Pinto Colvig (Cactus Kid), Billy Bletcher, John McLeish (Bellboy Donald), Jim Cummings, and Katsuhiro Kitagawa (Japanese).

In the 80s, Will Ryan supplied Pete's voice in Disney projects like Mickey's Christmas Carol, Down and Out with Donald Duck, and DuckTales.

This was until Jimmy Cummings became the official voice actor of Pete.

In Summary

Pete is not a new character from Disney, as he made his first appearance in Alice Solves the Puzzle in 1925.

Although he was often mistaken for a dog, Pete from the Disney Mickey Mouse Clubhouse is actually a cat.

Disney introduced him as a dominating character to make him appear the bad guy throughout the series, but don't you deny it - he left you crackling and pissed off at the same time.
